selectedVerses.text: His underparts are like sharp potsherds; he spreads himself like a threshing sledge on the mire.
their arrows are sharp, all their bows bent, their horses' hoofs seem like flint, and their wheels like the whirlwind.
Your tongue plots destruction, like a sharp razor, you worker of deceit.
Then I looked, and behold, a white cloud, and seated on the cloud one like a son of man, with a golden crown on his head, and a sharp sickle in his hand.
but in the end she is bitter as wormwood, sharp as a two-edged sword.
